newsitem.title: USA: Delta stock rises after "blowout" quarter.
newsitem.headline: Delta stock rises after "blowout" quarter.

text.p: Shares in Delta Air Lines Inc rose sharply on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday after the carrier reported quarterly earnings that exceeded Wall Street expectations by more than 15 percent.
"It was a blowout quarter for earnings," said Susan Donofrio, an analyst at NatWest Securities Corp.
Analysts had expected Delta to earn $1.40 per share in its second quarter, which ended December 31. But the actual result was $1.63 fully diluted versus $0.93 per share a year ago.
By late morning, Delta shares were up 1-7/8 at 84-5/8, putting them within three points of a 52-week high of 87.
